author: raghushantha
body:
On linux/OSX, certain PkgMgmt functionality such as bootstrapping, updating providers are broken because of the dependency on the following env variables:

$env:APPDATA
$env:LOCALAPPDATA
$env:ProgramFiles

These make sense only on Windows. We need to use platform agnostic methods to manage bootstrapping.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: Do you mean only on Windows, or on Linux too? They don't make much sense on Linux, and should be inherited from the environment on Windows.

comments.author: raghushantha
comments.body:
PackageManagement bootstrapping mechanism uses these paths to manage out-of-box providers (such as Nuget Provider, PackageList provider).

Also, PowerShellGet uses programfiles location to install modules from the Gallery.

For Linux, the above is broken without these variables being initialized. 

Ideally PkgMgmt must not take dependency on platform specific paths..

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: PkgMgmt will need to be modified to use XDG BDS locations on Linux / OS X, it cannot use the Windows variables. @ealexjordan can help with this.

comments.author: ealexjordan
comments.body:
As per the meeting, the XDG specifications are at:
https://specifications.freedesktop.org/basedir-spec/basedir-spec-latest.html

The following issue and pull request may also be of some help: 
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/935
https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/1060

title: [PackageManagement] Need to use platform agnostic methods to manage bootstrapping
